editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: PETER OF HERENTHALS ON THE PSALTER; S. XV 2/4

msItem.note: fol. i is blank; on the verso is ‘Exposicio in psalmos per Petrum priorem ecclesiae Floreffiensis et ordinis praemonstratensis’, s. xvii, doubtless copied from an earlier inscription now lost.

msItem.author: PETER OF HERENTHALS
msItem.title: Commentary on the Psalter
msItem.incipit: Patri reuerendo dominoque meo carissimo domino Iohanni de Archel
Pater karissime cum rem quamlibet honestatis splendore perspicuam
Beatus uir ...; Psalterium est quasi magna domus que habet plures cubiculos
msItem.explicit: (fol. 331) et intellectus humiliter obedire ad laudem
msItem.rubric: (fol. 331v) Incipit exposicio super sex psalmos canticorum
msItem.incipit: Confitebor ...; Iste est primus psalmus canticorum
msItem.explicit: (ends impf. in the Canticum Hezechiae = Is. 39: 10–20) ad destruendum Ierusalem et per nuncios

supportDesc.extent:
335 leaves (i + 334) 250 170
170 105
The edges retrimmed and stained red.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with ink in 2 cols of 41 lines. Psalm-numbers as running heads.

handDesc.handNote: A single proficient English hand to fol. 331, writing bastard anglicana. Another of the same thereafter.

decoDesc.decoNote: English: 7-line initials in colours and gold, with foliage and full borders, on fols. 1, 7, 256 (Ps. 109); 6-line initials with 3-sided borders fols. 54v (Ps. 26), 84v (Ps. 38), 119v (Ps. 50), 121 (Ps. 52), 159v, 160 (Pss. 68–9), 192v (Ps. 80), 226v (Ps. 97); blue initials flourished in red, 3-line to begin Psalms, 1-line to begin verses; lemmata in red; auctoritates underlined and highlighted in red.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on six bands; formerly chained from the usual position. The first and last leaves were pastedowns in an earlier binding. At the foot of fol. i is the mark of a brass chain-staple; on fol. 334 are the marks of two strap-pins.

history.provenance: Made in England, a high-quality, commercial product.
Bequeathed by Robert Elyot, fellow of All Souls College, d. 1498, for whom see MS 46. The book was received in the library on 5 August 1499 (Registrum, p. 235).
Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with a title and ‘F. 2, 3’ (canc.), s. xvii, and ‘O. 8. 8. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘C. 2. 2 (CXCIII)’ in red; the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, p. 76; Powicke, no. 1131; Alexander & Temple, no. 475.
